intro: Scleria alta, commonly known as the tall scutch grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as along riverbanks and in swampy areas. Its tall, slender stems can reach up to 2 meters in height, and it produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Scleria alta is characterized by its fibrous, rhizomatous root system and its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils.
